featured.text: His paintings constantly reflected his desire to escape from society.
I always call out floors very clearly, and I am constantly on the move.
The additional tines made diners less likely to drop food, and the curved tines served as a scoop so people did not have to constantly switch to a spoon while eating.
In this way, dioxin is globally distributed, and as a consequence, every member of the human population is constantly exposed to this poisonous substance.

other.text: The cattle constantly change directions to avoid wind chill.
The expression “constantly on the move” in the passage refers to the fact that __________.

definition.en_def: In a manner that occurs continuously over a period of time.
definition.example: She is constantly seeking new challenges in her career.
